channel.title: PostgreSQL Initialization on Run production-grade databases easily on Kubernetes
channel.description: Recent content in PostgreSQL Initialization on Run production-grade databases easily on Kubernetes

item.title: Initialize Postgres from WAL
item.description: New to KubeDB? Please start here. Don’t know how to take continuous backup? Check tutorial on Continuous Archiving. PostgreSQL Initialization KubeDB supports PostgreSQL database initialization. When you create a new Postgres object, you can provide existing WAL files to restore from by “replaying” the log entries. Before You Begin At first, you need to have a Kubernetes cluster, and the kubectl command-line tool must be configured to communicate with your cluster.

item.title: Initialize Postgres using Script Source
item.description: New to KubeDB? Please start here. Initialize PostgreSQL with Script KubeDB supports PostgreSQL database initialization. Before You Begin At first, you need to have a Kubernetes cluster, and the kubectl command-line tool must be configured to communicate with your cluster. If you do not already have a cluster, you can create one by using minikube. Now, install KubeDB cli on your workstation and KubeDB operator in your cluster following the steps here.

item.title: Initialize Postgres using Snapshot Source
item.description: Don’t know how backup works? Check tutorial on Instant Backup. Initialize PostgreSQL with Snapshot KubeDB supports PostgreSQL database initialization. Before You Begin At first, you need to have a Kubernetes cluster, and the kubectl command-line tool must be configured to communicate with your cluster. If you do not already have a cluster, you can create one by using minikube. Now, install KubeDB cli on your workstation and KubeDB operator in your cluster following the steps here.
